name: One-Pan Creamy Sun-Dried Tomato Chicken Orzo
description: Family-friendly chicken and orzo simmered in sun-dried tomato sauce and stock, finished with peas, cherry tomatoes, parmesan, and basil. Mild, quick, and comforting.
prep_steps: Cut chicken thigh fillets into bite-size pieces and pat dry.
Grate parmesan cheese if not pre-grated.
Pick basil leaves and chop roughly.
Measure chicken stock and sun-dried tomato pasta sauce.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken thigh fillets lightly with salt and pepper, then add to the skillet and sear until lightly browned, 4–5 minutes.
Add onions and cook, stirring, until softened, 2–3 minutes; add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Stir in orzo and toast for 1 minute to coat with oil and aromatics.
Pour in chicken stock and sun-dried tomato pasta sauce; stir, bring to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low.
Cover and cook, stirring once or twice, until orzo is just tender and most liquid is absorbed, 10–12 minutes.
Stir in peas and cherry tomatoes; cook uncovered 2–3 minutes until peas are heated through and sauce is creamy. If too thick, add a splash of stock or water.
Remove from heat; fold in parmesan cheese and half the basil. Taste and adjust salt and pepper.
Top with remaining basil and serve hot.
